original_title: Lessons Learned While Building a DIY Pen Plotter
original_content:
There was a time when plotters were the pinnacle of computer graphics output. While they arent as common as they used to be, there are some advantages to having a plotter. [Symon] wanted a plotter and decided to make one from scratch. Truthfully, he wants to build a CNC machine, so the plotter is just a stepping stone. In fact, some of it may be a little much for just a plotter. Other design choices have worked for the plotter, but dont look like they will work well for the eventual CNC design.
As an example, the plotter uses 2020 extrusions and lead screws. An Arduino with a CNC shield provides the brains. GRBL, of course, runs on the Arduino, so the whole machine runs fine with normal G-code. This post will be especially interesting if you want to build a plotter or something similar. We especially like that it covers the design rationale for each choice made It is great to learn from others successes and, of course, their mistakes.
If you really want just a plotter, you dont have to spend much. You can even go super minimal if you want.
title: スクラッチから作るプロッター：CNCマシンへの第一歩
body: プロッターはコンピューターグラフィックスの出力の最高峰だったが、最近は一般的でない。[Symon]はプロッターを作りたくて、ゼロから作ることにした。実際には、彼はCNCマシンを作りたいので、プロッターはその一歩だ。デザインの一部はプロッターには過剰だが、将来のCNCデザインにはうまくはたらかない可能性がある。
